```{r}
library(plotly)

# Sample data for demonstration
x <- seq(1, 100, length.out = 10)
y <- seq(1, 100, length.out = 10)
z <- outer(x, y, function(x, y) sin(x/10) * cos(y/10))

# 3D Surface Plot
fig <- plot_ly(x = ~x, y = ~y, z = ~z, type = 'surface',
               colorscale = list(c(0, 'blue'), c(1, 'red')),
               showscale = FALSE) # Turn off color scale

# Customize layout
fig <- fig %>%
  layout(scene = list(xaxis = list(title = 'Years_of_Treatment'),
                      yaxis = list(title = 'Patient Age'),
                      zaxis = list(title = 'Recovery_Index')),
         title = "Improved 3D Plot")

fig
```

```{r}
# Load necessary library
library(scatterplot3d)

# Sample data for demonstration
x <- rnorm(100)  # Random data for x-axis
y <- rnorm(100)  # Random data for y-axis
z <- rnorm(100)  # Random data for z-axis

# Create a 3D scatter plot
s3d <- scatterplot3d(x, y, z, 
                     pch = 16,         # Set the plotting character to a filled circle
                     color = "blue",   # Color of the points
                     xlab = "X-axis",  # Label for the x-axis
                     ylab = "Y-axis",  # Label for the y-axis
                     zlab = "Z-axis",  # Label for the z-axis
                     main = "3D Scatter Plot",  # Main title of the plot
                     grid = TRUE,      # Adds grid lines to the plot
                     box = TRUE)       # Adds a box around the plot

# Optionally, you can add regression plane (or other elements) if needed
# Example of adding a regression plane:
fit <- lm(z ~ x + y)  # Fit a linear model
s3d$plane3d(fit, draw_polygon = TRUE, draw_lines = TRUE)  # Add regression plane to the plot
```

```{r}
# Load necessary library
library(scatterplot3d)

# Simulate data for warehouse logistics analysis
set.seed(123)
shipment_volume <- rnorm(100, mean = 500, sd = 50)  # Shipment volume
handling_time <- rnorm(100, mean = 30, sd = 5)      # Handling time (in minutes)
cost <- rnorm(100, mean = 1000, sd = 200)           # Cost (in dollars)

# Create a factor variable to represent different warehouse zones
warehouse_zone <- factor(sample(c("Zone A", "Zone B", "Zone C"), 100, replace = TRUE))

# Assign colors based on warehouse zones
colors <- c("red", "green", "blue")[as.numeric(warehouse_zone)]

# Create a 3D scatter plot
s3d <- scatterplot3d(shipment_volume, handling_time, cost, 
                     pch = 19,          # Set the plotting character to a filled circle
                     color = colors,    # Use the colors based on warehouse zones
                     xlab = "Shipment Volume (units)",  # Label for the x-axis
                     ylab = "Handling Time (minutes)",  # Label for the y-axis
                     zlab = "Cost ($)",  # Label for the z-axis
                     main = "3D Scatter Plot of Warehouse Logistics",  # Main title of the plot
                     grid = TRUE,        # Adds grid lines to the plot
                     box = TRUE)         # Adds a box around the plot

# Add a legend to the plot
legend("topright", legend = levels(warehouse_zone), col = c("red", "green", "blue"), pch = 19)
```
